hoard.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a collection of things that someone hides somewhere, especially so they can use them later
hoard.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the discovery of a hoard of gold coins
hoard.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to collect and save large amounts of food, money etc, especially when it is not necessary to do so
hoard.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: families who hoarded food during the strike
hoard.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to collect and save large amounts of something in order to sell it later at a high price or because you think there might not be enough available in the future
hoard.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Banks must be discouraged from hoarding dollars.

hoard.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a store of money or goods kept to be used or sold in the future
hoard.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The company has a large cash hoard.
